Subject: RE: [junit] Support for JUnit

List-Unsubscribe: <mailto:junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
From: Peter Spitz <pspitz@...>

I don't know about anyone else, but I find that the support from this
mailing list is excellent.

The problems you see here are real-life ones, encountered by people using
the product. It's likely that any problems you encounter will have already
been encountered (and solved) by other people and the answers will be in
these archives. That's certainly been my experience.

We also started using JUnit recently, but I didn't have to do much in the
way of formal documentation to convince management to support it. It was
more a matter of "hey, look at this really neat way of doing automated unit
testing. Once we had a decent set of automated unit tests, there was no
turning back.

Hope this is of some help,
Peter
subject: RE: [junit] Support for JUnit
